title: Part A

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe a solution for reversing the pattern of economic damage seen for VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ in the eastern United States, such as any of the following:

· Increase the use of vapor recovery nozzles at gasoline pumps

· Increase the efficiency of gasoline engines (use less gasoline)

· Reduce the use of products containing VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ (e.g. paints, adhesives, cleaning agents)

· Reduce VOC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbaaaa@3A8A@ use in manufacturing (e.g. solvents used in paints and coatings)

· Reduce VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ used in pesticides

· Replace gasoline-powered cars with electric cars

· Reduce coal/oil/natural gas use

· Reduce wood-burning and switch to renewable energy sources to generate electricity

· Legislation/regulations to reduce VOC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbaaaa@3A8A@ emissions

The response describes a solution for reversing the pattern of economic damage seen for VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ in the eastern United States, such as one of the following:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe an area in the United States that would most likely experience high levels of photochemical smog such as the following:

· A major city, in a warm climate that gets much sunlight and has high damage from NO X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOtaiaab+eadaWgaaWcbaGaaeiwaaqabaaaaa@3AC3@ and VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ , because photochemical smog is formed when both nitrogen oxides and VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ react with heat and sunlight. In the maps, both NO X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOtaiaab+eadaWgaaWcbaGaaeiwaaqabaaaaa@3AC3@ and VOCs MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaeOvaiaab+eacaqGdbGaae4Caaaa@3B80@ cause considerable damage in California and the Midwest, where there is ample sunlight for photochemical reactions to occur.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify one of the mapped pollutants that is produced during the combustion of coal and explain how wind patterns and the location of the sources of the pollutant lead to its pattern of economic damage such as the following:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify PM 2.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aabcfacaqGnbWaaSbaaSqaaiaabkdacaqGUaGaaeynaaqabaaaaa@3BE6@ as one of the mapped air pollutants the farmer could accurately be thinking will be reduced and does not make a claim using evidence that supports the assertion that incorporating no-till farming at the farm will reduce emissions of PM 2.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aabcfacaqGnbWaaSbaaSqaaiaabkdacaqGUaGaaeynaaqabaaaaa@3BE6@ because it disturbs soils less than traditional plowing.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify and describe one method that emerged during the Green Revolution that would not contribute to air pollution but has negatively impacted soil composition, such as any of the following:

· Irrigation techniques (furrow, center-point, flood) lead to water logging/salinization of soil.

· Increased use of tillers/soil tillage disrupts soil structure and accelerates soil erosion.

· Increased use of chemical pesticides disrupts soil microorganisms.

· Monoculture farming planting a single crop over vast areas leads to nutrient depletion and altered soil composition.

· The use of phosphate fertilizers can cause the buildup of excessive phosphate in croplands leading to altered soil composition and reduced fertility.

The response identifies and describes one method that emerged during the Green Revolution that would not contribute to air pollution but has negatively impacted soil composition, such as one of the following:

· Irrigation techniques (furrow, center-point, flood) lead to water logging/salinization of soil.

· Increased use of tillers/soil tillage disrupts soil structure and accelerates soil erosion.

· Increased use of chemical pesticides disrupts soil microorganisms.

· Monoculture farming planting a single crop over vast areas leads to nutrient depletion and altered soil composition.

· The use of phosphate fertilizers can cause the buildup of excessive phosphate in croplands leading to altered soil composition and reduced fertility.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not make a claim that proposes a solution to the problem identified in part (f), such as any of the following:

Irrigation (problem in part (f)).

· Use drip irrigation/spray irrigation

· Use timers for watering

· Water plants in the early morning/late evening to reduce evaporation

Soil Tillage (problem in part (f)).

· Use conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) to reduce soil erosion

· Use organic material/green manure to reduce or prevent soil erosion

· Use organic material/green manure to reduce dependence on chemical pesticides

· Use crop rotation

· Use terracing

Monocultures (problem in part (f)).

· Use of Intercropping

· Use of Polyculture farming

· Use of Agroforestry

Increased use of phosphate fertilizer (problem in part (f)).

· Use of a cover crop

The response makes a claim that proposes a solution to the problem identified in part (f), such as one of the following:

Irrigation (problem in part (f)).

· Use drip irrigation/spray irrigation

· Use timers for watering

· Water plants in the early morning/late evening to reduce evaporation

Soil Tillage (problem in part (f)).

· Use conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) to reduce soil erosion

· Use organic material/green manure to reduce or prevent soil erosion

· Use organic material/green manure to reduce dependence on chemical pesticides

· Use crop rotation

· Use terracing

Monocultures (problem in part (f)).

· Use of Intercropping

· Use of Polyculture farming

· Use of Agroforestry

Increased use of phosphate fertilizer (problem in part (f)).

· Use of a cover crop

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one disadvantage or unintended consequence that could result from the solution proposed in part (g), such as any of the following:

Use drip irrigation/spray irrigation, use timers for watering, or water plants in the early morning/late evening to reduce evaporation (solution in part (g)).

· Drip irrigation tubes can get clogged or the plastic degrades so that it doesn’t deliver any water

· Pipes and hoses needed for drip irrigation are expensive.

· Spraying water can be blown away when windy

Use conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) to reduce soil erosion, use organic material/green manure to reduce or prevent soil erosion, use organic material/green manure to reduce dependence on chemical pesticides, use crop rotation, or use terracing (solution in part (g)).

· Conservation tillage practices can require more herbicides

· Conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) practices can require purchasing new equipment

· Microbial activity tends to be slower in conservation tillage systems (than when organic material is incorporated into soil by conventional tillage)

· Nutrients often stratify in conservation tillage, and tend to be higher near the surface, which may hinder crop growth

· Use of green manure typically requires water for decomposition process, therefore water use may increase

Use of Intercropping, use of Polyculture farming, or use of Agroforestry (solution in part (g)).

· Decreased yields

· Crop management can be more challenging to plan

· Different equipment may be required compared to monoculture farming

Use of a cover crop (solution in part (g)).

· May increase insect pests and diseases

· Additional costs

· Often need to be planted when labor is more limited

The response describes one disadvantage or unintended consequence that could result from the solution proposed in part (g), such as one of the following:

Use drip irrigation/spray irrigation, use timers for watering, or water plants in the early morning/late evening to reduce evaporation (solution in part (g)).

· Drip irrigation tubes can get clogged or the plastic degrades so that it doesn’t deliver any water

· Pipes and hoses needed for drip irrigation are expensive.

· Spraying water can be blown away when windy

Use conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) to reduce soil erosion, use organic material/green manure to reduce or prevent soil erosion, use organic material/green manure to reduce dependence on chemical pesticides, use crop rotation, or use terracing (solution in part (g)).

· Conservation tillage practices can require more herbicides

· Conservation tillage (e.g., no-till) practices can require purchasing new equipment

· Nutrients often stratify in conservation tillage, and tend to be higher near the surface, which may hinder crop growth

· Use of green manure typically requires water for decomposition process, therefore water use may increase
